page.title: 12The Village of Eryrys.
page.content: Eryrys village stands at about 1,200 feet. It has one church, chapel, general shop, public house, post office and youth club. The village consists of clustered housing around the road and more scattered houses round about. There are 26 council built properties - 20 houses and 6 old peoples bungalows, 25 private houses, 2 holiday homes and 2 small caravan sites. An approximate breakdown of the population shows that there are around 150 inhabitants, 22 elderly and 29 children. 44 people are welsh speaking. There are about 9 unemployed, 36 manual workers including farmers, builders, mechanics and quarry men, and 28 white collar workers who commute to local towns and to the cities of Liverpool and Manchester.
